election_record.label: Vermont 1820 Governor

overview.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 13152 votes for Richard Skinner; however, the sum of totals per county is 13491.
The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT) and The Vermont Republican and American Yeoman (Windsor, VT) report 13152 votes for Richard Skinner.

"The election for state officers in this state took place on Tuesday the 5th instant, their is no doubt but the state ticket which we published has succeeded, their was but little opposition. From the general apathy which operates upon the citizens we have been unable to collect the votes for governor." Vermont Gazette (Bennington, VT). September 12, 1820.

sub_unit.name: Vergennes
sub_unit.note: The votes from Waltham are included in the totals for Vergennes.

sub_unit.name: Saint Johnsbury
sub_unit.note: The Saint Johnsbury Town Records lists only the two votes for John Mattocks.

sub_unit.name: Sheffield
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 44 votes for Richard Skinner in Sheffield.

sub_unit.name: Walden
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 54 votes for Richard Skinner in Walden.

sub_unit.name: Chittenden
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 840 votes for Richard Skinner in Chittenden County.

sub_unit.name: Mansfield
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet has no returns for Mansfield, with the note "No ballots."

sub_unit.name: Granby
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Granby.

sub_unit.name: Limington
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Limington.

sub_unit.name: Minehead
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Minehead.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 671 votes for Richard Skinner in Franklin County.

sub_unit.name: Belvidere
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Belvidere.

sub_unit.name: Fairfax
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and Journal of the Vermont General Assembly do not list any votes for Richard Skinner in Fairfax.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 24 votes for Richard Skinner.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 1260 votes for Richard Skinner in Orange County.

sub_unit.name: Chelsea
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and the Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 18 scattering votes in Chelsea.

sub_unit.name: Roxbury
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet does not have any returns for Roxbury; there is a note that the votes were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Topsham
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet lists 65 votes for Richard Skinner and 3 scattering votes in Tophsam.

sub_unit.name: Orleans
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 488 votes for Richard Skinner in Orleans County.

sub_unit.name: Navy
sub_unit.note: The votes from Navy were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and the Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 693 votes for Richard Skinner in Washington County.

sub_unit.name: Fayston
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Fayston.

sub_unit.name: Marshfield
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and the Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 33 votes for Richard Skinner and one scattering vote in Marshfield.

sub_unit.name: Northfield
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and the Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 74 votes for Richard Skinner and 5 votes for Dudley Chase in Northfield.

sub_unit.name: Plainfield
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and the Journal of the Vermont General Assembly do not have any vote counts in Plainfield.

sub_unit.name: Worcester
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Worcester.

sub_unit.name: Windham
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet and the Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 1341 votes for Richard Skinner in Windham County; however, the sum of totals per town is 1541.

sub_unit.name: Brattleboro
sub_unit.note: The Brattleboro Town Records lists 73 votes for Richard Skinner and 9 votes without designation that were given to Skinner.

sub_unit.name: Guilford
sub_unit.note: The Official Election Returns tally sheet and the Journal of the Vermont General Assembly list 75 votes for Richard Skinner in Guilford.

sub_unit.name: Baltimore
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Baltimore.

sub_unit.name: Rochester
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet lists 73 votes for Richard Skinner, 5 votes for Dudley Chase and 3 scattering votes.
The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly lists 73 votes for Richard Skinner.

sub_unit.name: Sharon
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Sharon.

sub_unit.name: Weston
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Weston.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Vermont State Archives, Middlesex.
Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1820. 245-247.
Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT). October 23, 1820.
Vermont Republican and American Yeoman (Windsor, VT). October 23, 1820.
Fairbanks, Edward Taylor. The Town of St. Johnsbury VT: a review of one hundred and twenty-five years to the anniversary pageant 1912. St. Johnsbury, VT: The Cowles Press, 1914. 571.
Phelps, James Houghton. Collections Relating to the History and Inhabitants of the Town of Townshend, Vermont. Townshend, VT: G.E. Selleck, 1877. 229.
